Reviews.Title: “Superb location with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: PinakiMishra
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a day in April on a business trip to Rome before joining my conference in Marriott. The location of the hotel is just perfect. Just climb up on the Spanish Steps and you are there. The Espania metro stop is down the steps and most of the key attractions are within 15-20 mins walk. I arrived when it was raining and my room was not available. I was immediately offered an upgrade so that I did not have to wait for 2 hours. Just for 1 night stay, that was great ! The staff was excellent lugging my suitcase up the stairs when it was not really necessary. The room was clean and had good quality finish. The breakfast was quite adequate by Rome standards and everything was well taken care of. Great staff, great location and very good rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pishi
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 15 years ago and wanted to return for a 3 night stay. It is a bit dated now from what we remembered, but still ok for the money and you cannot get a better location and view in this part of the city. Everything is either walking distance or a short cab ride. The room is a good size and the view is very nice. Breakfast is very average, we decided to go elsewhere after 1st day.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Stay”
Reviews.Author: John-Murielle
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful boutique hotel less than one minute's walk from the top of the Spanish Steps. Having less than 20 rooms and a friendly staff made our stay here seemed more like a visit home ... and that is a good thing! One other reviewer questioned the cleanliness; nonsense. Our room, the common areas including the coffee, breakfast area and patio were immaculate. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Service With the Best Location”
Reviews.Author: KarieDan L
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel with an amazing location at the top of the Spanish Steps. The people who work there were very friendly and helpful. They made the trip to Rome that much better. We had 2 rooms there that were both nice and comfortable and the free WiFi was very useful. They recommended some of the best food for dinner and the free breakfast had something good for all of us. I look forward to being able to go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Bronco10708
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my daughter in late July. It is lovely. The location is terrific-pretty much everything is in walking distance and there is a lot of activity yards away near the Spanish Steps, yet the hotel is tucked away and it is fairly quiet. The owners and the staff are very nice and helpful about restaurants, sites and directions. We had what was essentially a double room, with a small antechamber with a bed and a bigger bedroom. It was very nicely decorated and while a bit tight was very comfortable. Breakfast was fine-with a good variety of items. Only breakfast drawback was the pigeons on the outside terrace that go after scraps when people don't clear their tables, but otherwise the ability to start the day with an open air meal was great. A great hotel and it is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very nice hotel for weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Grant W
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 4 on the ground floor for 3 nights. The room was large and comfortable. Staff were very friendly, welcoming and helpful. Breakfast was nice, and Sky and free WiFi were very useful. Location was excellent, right at the top of the Spanish steps, lots to see and do, plenty of excellent eating places nearby. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs...”
Reviews.Author: lizbxx
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very small breakfast is stale and not great and we had BED BUGS hundreds of them...

Reviews.Title: “Nice base for your Roman holiday”
Reviews.Author: carlosochoa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at the top of the Spanish Steps, and right next to them. It is easily reached by the "Spagna" metro station and then using the public elevator (or climb the steps for the experience) The building exterior is simple, but the interior and rooms are decorated in a way that makes you feel in a small palace, and they are well maintained. For some travellers rooms might be small, but mine was adequate. Bath area was huge, even included slippers (as long, long time ago). They have a full digital cable TV package, including multilingual programs. Each room has its dedicated Wifi router, and speed is quite good. Be warned that only rooms in the entrance level might be wheelchair accesible, as there is no elevator only stairs. Breakfast takes place in the terrace. There are few rooms, so service is more personal and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The only minuses were that breakfast was the same during all my stay, and that despite the huge bathroom, the shower was placed in a way that was not suitable for full movement. Water pressure was low, so water sometimes was too hot or too cold. Despite all that, it is a very nice hotel, one that you would like to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCEEDED EXPECTATIONS”
Reviews.Author: Kootingal66
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in October in Room 10 on the first floor above reception, same floor as the gorgeous breakfast room, and with three windows overlooking the wide street below - and aside from a nuisance shower rose we loved our stay. Being our first time in Italy we were warned of very small rooms, etc but were so susprised to find we had an entry/foyer with couch, and a large separate bedroom with comfortable queen size bed and bathroom large enough for us both to use at the same time. The windows and view to the street and the hustle and bustle of Italian daily lifestyle below was a bonus, I must admit I was worried it might be noisy, but we didn't hear a thing from outside. The breakfast every morning was lovely, particularly when we chose to enjoy it outside on the patio with views overlooking roof tops and basilicas in the distance. We also utilised this outdoor patio area of an evening for pre dinner drinks and watching the sun go down. Our friends stayed down the street at the expensive Intercontinental, and we were proud to say our room was bigger, our bathroom was bigger and our wifi was free!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location !”
Reviews.Author: Schadau
Reviews.Content: Tucked away to the side at the top of the Spanish Steps, this beautifull little boutique hotel has a better location than it's big, famous, expensive neighbour The Hassler (Tom Cruise should be walking across the street !). Charming (smallish) rooms with gorgeous wall fabric and antique furnishings provide a quiet oasis from the busy center of Old Rome just outside your door. Adjacent to the hotel is a wonderful restaurant/cafe (Nuovocentro) run by the charming "Mimmo" (Massimo) who delivers excellent snacks and panini to accompany your wine from their excellent (and extensive) wine list. Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: janiem04
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with two other couples for two nights. The hotel staff was very accomodating and helpful. We stayed here five years ago and we were happy to come back again. The staff is very accomodating and the roof top breakfast is very nice. Watch out for the pidgeons. They will steal your food! The rooms are clean and the beds comfortable. The location at the top of the Spanish Steps makes it easy to walk to the night life. The metro is literally steps away and there is a taxi stand right outside the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but average hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Two_Travel_Bugs_WI
Reviews.Content: We experienced a combination of positive and negative aspects during our one-night stay at the Hotel Scalinata di Spagna. Positives - the room was quite large by European standards, and was clean and well-appointed. The front-desk staff was kind and helpful, if a bit too pushy when recommending a car service immediately upon our arrivel (which turned out to be a nightmare, actually, but we won't discredit the hotel for that). The hotel does have a lovely rooftop terrace to enjoy a bit of calm and relaxation after a busy Rome day. And, of course, the location is superb - right at the top of the Spanish Steps, it couldn't be beat in that part of the city. Negatives - Though the web site, and the front desk staff, claimed our room had a view of the Spanish Steps, this was lacking. We could really only see the side of the steps, and our tiny balcony wasn't large enough for two to really even stand on. But, the rooftop terrace made up for that. Breakfast was ok, but somewhat underwhelming when compared to the others we experienced while in Italy. In our specific room, the shower head was broken, and it appears it had been for some time (there was a putty-like substance what was supposed to hold the head to the fixture, but it didn't work at all - the shower head lay on the bathtub floor for our entire stay!). And, we felt that the price was quite high at 270 euros for what we actually got. You really are paying just for the location. Overall, the positives and negatives really balanced out for us. We had higher expectations, and certainly weren't "wowed." It wasn't a bad stay, per se, but we probably wouldn't return or recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay at the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: MilanoCleopatra
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Scalinata for 2 nights and it was a delightful experience although a bit overpriced. The room was spacious and clean, tastefully decorated however the view from room 9 was a bit disappointing as it was looking to the back of the hotel. Breakfast was very good, service too however due to rainy showers i did not have the opportunity to enjoy the terrace. Location is excellent as it is literally at the top of the Spanish steps and helps you get around the city. Having stayed to other hotels in centro historico i would have chosen Scalinata again if only the price was a bit lower than it is.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: justin l
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel scalinata and definitely recommend it to anyone. We were there for 3 nights, but we thought that the scalinata was good, clean, amazing location, great bedrooms, compact but nicely furnished bathrooms. But i think the best thing at the Scalinata was the hospitality, they were very friendly, helpful and made you feel most welcome.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible location”
Reviews.Author: Darnmavin1978
Reviews.Content: WE LOVED our stay!! Nothing was too much for this staff! From the initial contact to the checkout, it was service with a smile! Anything you wanted, the answer was always positive and always with a smile. They made us feel truly welcome. Breakfast was simple, but very tasty and typical. Hope to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: SW11London_family
Reviews.Content: We would recommend HSdS. The service was exceptional (booking travel, advice on sites and restaurants, questions about the room). It IS a B&B but step out onto the Piazza Trinita dei Monti and there is a bar to your left and a restaurant to your right (admittedly pricey - go down the steps to your left to a cheaper one or ask the team for recommendations) . We were puzzled by the very few negative reviews. This location is fantastic. Nothing worse in Rome with kids than being in a "non" location requiring time and effort to get to the sites. You are in the heart of Rome as you emerge from the door and can walk to the Trevi, Parthenon etc easily. And of course the Spanish Steps is on the doorstep. Forum and Vatican are a cab ride away. The hotel is quiet, clean,very nicely decorated, and with good beds and aircon (essential in the summer). Basic but clean bathrooms. Across the road is the far more expensive Hassler (when we stayed there was much excitement as Bernie Ecclestone was staying there for his daughter's wedding).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic And Fabio was THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: bridgebysue
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel. It was such a wonderful way to end my 2 week Italy, Greece and Croatia cruise. Fabio, the Hotel Concierge runs a quality operation with this charming quaint place to stay. Not only were the rooms lovely, but you had access to the garden roof whichprovided a wonderful view of the city of Rome. Along with the best price around, a full breakfast was served before departure. Fabio and his staff arrived especially early to accomodate us before our flight home to the states, I would stay there again any time and I highly recommend it to all. This hotel, situated at the top of The Spanish Steps is nestled in among hotels that are four times the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved my second stay here even more than my first”
Reviews.Author: BizLuxTrvlr
Reviews.Content: Had stayed there 4 years ago and wanted to return. Even better experience this time as I had the room with the private terrace overlooking Rome. Location of the Scalinata can't be beat -- you can walk everywhere. Staff is friendly and the rooms though small are nicely decorated and clean. It's a great alternative the the very pricey Hassler across the street.

Reviews.Title: “We were there 30 years ago and wanted to return”
Reviews.Author: indbob
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is really a Pensione. It is a small comfortable facility run by very nice people. It has a roof terrace for breakfast and the rooms are small but comfortable. The Air conditioning was marginal and the television controls were impossible to understand. There is no elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with nice rooms, friendly, helpful staff...”
Reviews.Author: kinnis1969
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Scalinata di Spagna. It is located right at the top of the Spanish Steps, tucked away in a lovely building next to 2 restaurants, one on the right, one on the left. When we arrived we were so happily welcomed by Fabio, the owner himself. Fabio is so warm, friendly, talkative, helpful! His desk is on the left right inside the door, then there's a little room on the right with a computer for the guests to use, maps, magazines, informational pamphlets, etc. My husband and I were on vacation for our 20th anniversary. We stayed here 3 nights at the beginning of our trip, then one more night at the end of our trip. First we stayed in a ground-level room at the end of the hall on the left. The room was pretty small, but quiet and quite comfortable. I prefered the second room at the end of our trip, which was on the second floor. It was a bit bigger, more comfy, wonderful a/c, a wrap-around balcony...right near the breakfast room with the awesome automatic cappuchino-maker. The breakfast room also has an outside roof-top area with a few tables, views of Rome. Over-all, the hotel was like a home-away-from-home, with it's welcoming feel because of the people who work there and the comfiness of the rooms. We miss Fabio!

Reviews.Title: “The staff was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Kim54917
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 nights in June with our 3 children. We reserved a family suite which consisted of 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, each with their own door and then an outside door to reach both rooms. We were pleased with our rooms overall. My husband's and my room and bathroom were very clean and decorated nicely, but the major problem for us was that they were very small. We had 2 large suitcases that had to be kept on luggage stands, which took up the precious space we had. Our daughters room was a triple, with a single bed and a queen bed. With children that are pre-teen and teen age, they appreciated not having a cot. Their room and bathroom were very spacious for 3 people. The one thing we were very disappointed in was the breakfast. There wasn't much selection and what was served was fair at best. We had a very difficult time finding anything we liked. We loved the staff in the hotel, and for that reason, we would consider staying here again. They were very friendly and helpful with recommendations, transportation, etc... We also loved the location of the hotel at the top of the Spanish Steps. Our children enjoyed the social scene on the steps in the evening. Overall a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and location”
Reviews.Author: BPLCC
Reviews.Content: The staff could not have been more helpful or pleasant. Recommendations for restaurants were outstanding and responses to any request were greeted with a smile. The Junior Suite was perfect for my wife and I and our teenage daughter. It was a bit small and there was a lack of space to unpack and get organized but it worked out fine. I have to say the breakfasts were a bit disappointing as they were very basic and if you aren't up early not so fresh. The highly touted patio area was disappointing as well particularly for breakfast as the highly aggressive pigeons ran us indoors very quickly! For the price I have to say I expected slightly better but overall it was a good experience and the location is so good it's worth a little extra!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - lots of people! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: RudyAZ
Reviews.Content: The moment we walked into the hotel we felt totally at home. You could not pick a better location and it's right next door to Valentino's Rome house!! The hotel is located right at the top of the Spanish Steps so during the day the area is full of people. Once you enter the hotel it is very quiet and cozy. Don't expect the rooms to be huge because they are not. Rooms in Italy are just small by everyday standards. What you will find is a very nicely decorated room that is clean and well maintained. Our room had a balcony and the view was really lovely. In the morning you wake up to the smell of warm croissants and the espresso machine at full speed! There is an outside area with tables so you can relax, enjoy the sights and drink your cappucino. Compared to other hotels in the area such as the Hassler and the InterContinental this is very reasonably priced. You are practically in the best location in Rome - walking distance to everything. If you want to risk your life in a cab through Rome there are plenty right outside the hotel. I would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy place in by the scalinata”
Reviews.Author: simoma
Reviews.Content: This small and cozy hotel is in located in one of the best places in Rome, at the top of Scalinata di Trinità dei Monti. Room and bathroom were small but nice and full equipped with an impressive view on the roofs of Rome. Service very good and friendly. Free internet and wi-fi. Breakfast in the roof top. The only aspect that I would not rate 5 stars. One of the best places to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: NJTraveler03
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic at the top of the Spanish Steps across a small piazza from the Hassler, steps from the metro station with a taxi stand in front of the hotel. The staff was very helpful (thank you to the Fabios and Renato). The staff gave us excellent restaurant recommendations ( not a single tourist trap among them). Our room was spacious and clean (we booked a junior suite facing the front of the hotel). Although our room had no view to speak of, right down the hall was a fantastic rooftop deck which provided excellent views of the city and even the dome of St. Peter's. Although the hotel had no bar or restaurant watching the sunset with a bottle of wine from a local store was the perfect end to a busy touring day in Rome. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “a quiet haven in the heart of busy Rome”
Reviews.Author: cinedra
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay here in Rome at the end of our 12day Italian vacation. We stayed in one of the basic single rooms with bathroom. The room was small and thin walls (we frequently got woken up in the mornings around 8am by other guests talking loudly outside and upstairs in the dining area). BUT despite these 2 things, our stay at Hotel Scalinata was great. The staff was exceptional! Our first day there, the front desk staff knew how to get us online same day reservations for the Vatican Museum, usually sold out days to weeks in advance. Our last night there, we got a great wine bar recommendation from the owner (who goes there regularily himself). Free wi-fi internet access was definately a BIG plus. 1 min away from the Spagna metro stop. The breakfast was adequate and we enjoyed having a espresso/cappuccino machine available 24/7. My husband loved the rooftop garden for quiet/relaxation time away from bustling Rome. I enjoyed being directly in the heart of Rome's prime shopping area! Stay at this place for a nice elegant, quiet break away from busy Rome with all of Rome being a walk outside your door.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel, perfect location but still quite.”
Reviews.Author: TinaVangen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, and I really feel I got paid back for the time searching for a hotel with the qualifications central, quite, balcony/terrace and not too expensive. Amazingly quite so near a busy place as the Spanish steps. The room was clean, personal were friendly and the breakfast was good with scrambled eggs and bacon, yoghurt, cakes ++ and espresso machine. But don’t leave your food unguarded outside, the pigeons are quickly on spot. PC with fast internet in the lobby. The restaurant outside to the right had very good lamb chops, but the scampi was a disaster. If you like fish try seabass at Edy nearby (Via del Babbuino)!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: BillyElliotFan
Reviews.Content: I just returned from nine days in Rome, and spent all of them at this hotel. I did a lot of research before my trip, and the reasons I chose this hotel were for the reasonable rates (especially for Rome and most especially for its location), the location, and the fact that it had a roof garden. I was really pleased with every aspect of the hotel and would highly recommend it. First of all, being there nine days, I met all the desk staff and without exception, they were all friendly, responsive and extremely helpful. A large breakfast is included in the rate, and even though it may be called continental, it had a lot more than continental breakfasts usually do: yogurt, breads, croissants, cheeses, meats, eggs, cereal, etc. You can have the breakfast in the dining room or in the lovely roof garden, which has a beautiful view over Rome, including St. Peter's. The roof garden is a great place to escape at night or even during the day to get some peace and quiet from the craziness that is Rome. While the area outside the hotel is crazy busy, once you're inside and especially in your room, it is very quiet. There is no reason to spend a ton of money for a "better known" hotel. How long do you spend in your room anyway? The Scalinata is charming, small (18 rooms), clean and comfortable. Here is a tip: The hotel is at the top of the Spanish Steps, but a secret is that there is an entrance to the metro at the top, as well. There is an elevator that will take you down all the way to the street level, and of course you can take the elevator from the street level to the top as well, so you don't ever need to climb the steps if you don't want to. And you do not need to buy a metro ticket to use the elevator. So don't let the prospect of climbing all those steps keep you away from the Scalinata. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: ozparker
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have got a better location, at the top of the Spanish Steps. Go straight down to via Condotti and further on the Vatican, or turn right and you're heading towards Borghese, or turn left and it's the Trevi Fountain. All within walking distance (OK, we did walk to the Vatican but I wouldn't recommend it for everyone as it was quite a long way). The hotel rooms were fairly small, especially considering we'd splurged on a deluxe version, but they were meticulously clean and had wonderful hot and powerful showers! The staff could not have been more welcoming or helpful. Breakfast is a little squishy in the terrace area but we found that if you get there early you could get in an out before the hordes. Alternatively sit out on the rooftop with its beautiful view if it's warm enough. I'd definitely choose to go back here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in the area.”
Reviews.Author: Elena1213
Reviews.Content: The location, amenities, staff, ambiance and price are priceless. You can't get any better location than this for the price per night. I started going to this hotel back in 1985 when the price was $25.00 per night, yes $25.00 and I have continued staying at this family run hotel on all my trips to Rome. My recent trip was over Easter vacation and the staff could not be more accommodating for me and my granddaughter. The rooms are spacious, clean, fresh towels daily, and the breakfast is superb. I recommed this hotel for short or long stays in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and service”
Reviews.Author: gaf1950
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Scalinata di Spagna for six nights. This was our fourth trip to Rome and the best experience we have had with a hotel. The location could not be better. Located at the top of the spanish steps you are within walking distance to all of the sights in Rome. We had a very nice room with a private terrace and a queen bed. Each morning we were provided with a delicious breakfast on a rooftop terrace with a spectacular view of Rome. The hotel staff is wonderful. Their attention to detail and service could not be better. Both Fabio and Renato are amazing. They are both dedicated to providing each guest with fantastic experience. Thank you for making our trip to Rome perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: 186225ZoL
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Really great staff. Lovely breakfast. Incredible views from the breakfast room and terrace. Our room (6) was nicely decorated, warm and very cosy. The staff were very kind to our children and very helpful. Good value for money. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “...waking up to the delicious smell of vanilla-scented cornettos every morning”
Reviews.Author: EnjoyingLife24
Reviews.Content: Scalinata is located right at the top of the Spanish Steps, if you don't want to hike up the stairs there is a public elevator adjacent to the Spagna Metro station to the left of the staircase going up. We requested and received a quiet, non-smoking room for three facing the courtyard. Rooms were very clean, mini-bar with space, plenty of closet space, CNN, safe-deposit box, extra blankets, comfortable beds, hair dryer, adjustable height shower in the bath, big towels, amenities(shampoo, soap, shower cap, q-tips), dry cleaning. Fabio and everyone who worked there was so very friendly, we were made to feel welcome. Fabio is a wealth of information regarding restaurants, buying tickets for soccer matches, the easiest way to get to X, and will even arrange for airport transfers if you need them. He always responded to our e-mails promptly, he responded immediately when we were arriving(checking-in) late and worried our reservations would be cancelled. There's a PC in the TV room off the lobby free for the guests to use, and free Wifi in the rooms as well. The breakfasts were amazing! Every morning we had delicious(!) hot scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, and bacon, freshly cut fruit, a choice of cereals, ham, raw ham, salami, cheese, fruit yoghurts, granola bars, and best of all, the hotel has a bakery so we were treated to still hot from the oven cornettos(croissants), filled with jams, compote, chocolate, or plain vanilla cornettos covered with powdered sugar! We enjoyed using the fancy electronic espresso/coffee machine to make our own cappucinos(the Signora will cheerfully make your first cup and show you how it works), teas, and hot chocolates, there was blood orange juice, pineapple juice and milk available too. No matter how tired we were from traipsing around the cobblestoned streets of Rome the day before, we were rewarded with the sweet smell of bread being baked each morning. The breakfast room upstairs had lots of light and a beautiful terrace. The location is very central you can walk to most sights, take the Metro, or the bus(the Republica bus stop is about five min. away on foot). Half the buses don't have maps or stops listed inside the bus so if you can get a hold of a bus map, do so. Unless you are driving to church, the taxis will take advantage of you so it really is important to be located centrally in Rome. There are always taxis present in front of the hotel(waiting for the Hotel Hassler guests) so if you do need a taxi no worries. If you have kids, there is a huge park a five min. walk down the street from the hotel, Villa Borghese where they can run around and enjoy kiddie rides. Scalinata offers great service, location, and breakfasts!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful stay, beautiful staff, beautiful spot”
Reviews.Author: sunny4087
Reviews.Content: this was just perfect. Staff took cared of us as if we were VIPs. Room comfortable and quiet, even though we were right at the top of the spanish steps. Rooftop terrace for that sunset glass of wine or that sunny breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Tipical italian hotel... Very good”
Reviews.Author: anghelus66
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only 1 day, after a bad experience in another hotel. The position is perfect, right in the center of Rome, rooms aren't that big, but big enough. You won't find any big rooms in the centre of Rome. This is a small, family owned, tipical italian hotel: italian breakfast, great croissants and coffe, italian staff very friendly and chatty, a great italian bar just outside where you can eat at lunch and dinner. They have a beautiful roof garden, where you can even see St. Peter's Cathedral. They have free internet, this is a plus for them, also. The bathroom was very clean and they cleaned and changed the sheets every day.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: anatolaHarakas
Reviews.Content: The staff was kind and gave us pretty great tips about restaurants, private guide to The Sistine Chappel and a friendly pick up ride from the airport. At the return we preffered the train from the station to the airport, but in the end it costed pretty much the same so I'd recommend to use a car from the airport instead of the trainf, if you are more than 3 people. Rooms are newly renovated, great view from the terrace where they also serve breakfast. We booked the family room that has a great view over Piaza Trinita dei Monti. The location is the best: right on top of the Spanish Steps. The subway is there, it is in the heart of Rome and most important locations you can get by foot. Breakfast was goog, they make good coffee, you shoul try the italian espresso, it is very good and strong, it gives you the energy for long walks. They have free internet in the rooms and even on the terrace. I spent a couple of ours in the small roof garden on the Internet with my wife, uploading photos on facebook. What to say? Hotel scalinata is a small 4 star hotel and it's worth all the money. It helped our perfect vacation to Rome. I recommend it to everybody who likes small hotels, without the noise and the crowd that big hotel offer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel, Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: hamwig
Reviews.Content: First time in Rome. Spent 5 great nights. Suite room was spacious and air conditioning excellent. Breakfast simple but typical for Italy. Perfect location for sightseeing, shopping and dinning. Look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “This was "my home away from home" !”
Reviews.Author: mirela_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Scalinata for 6 nights, this being my second time at this hotel (first time was last September). Since last fall, they improved everything: lobby, stairways, rooms, bathrooms, they were all refurbished. Rooms are decorated in traditional Italian style, very tasty and cozy too. There is a charming rooftop terrace where I had my breakfast while admiring the unique view of Rome. (the hotel is located on top of the Spanish Steps, next to a very old church Trnita dei Monti and so it offers a rare view from some of the rooms or from the terrace) The staff was very friendly and helpful and , they all speak perfect English. There is also a nice restaurant next door - Novecento- with great food, resonable prices and a very friendly staff. The rates at this rotel are really good, considering the best location you can find in Rome. I will always stay at Scalinata when in Rome. Mirela from Reston, Va

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: vermonty
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel primarily for the incredibly great location, just at the top of the Spanish Steps, across from the fancy Hassler. Our rooms were fine - a little dark/tired in terms of decor(we had the blue rooms in the hotel photos.) Bathrooms were impeccable and lovely. Breakfast was GREAT - only downside was machine coffee but my husband loved the always-available cappucino. Kids gave cool AC, breakfast, location and free wireless a big thumbs up. For Rome hotels this is a great value. We had a family suite - double/triple connecting rooms right off the breakfast area/terrace. No noise issues at all - recommend this setup for a family stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location - nice staff”
Reviews.Author: drmagref
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while in Rome for our Twenty-fifth anniversary. Although the room was small it was still quite comfortable. The location was very nice – top of the Spanish Steps – very romantic – On one evening we opened the doors to the “balcony” and could listen to opera from a performance on the Spanish Steps. Convenient location – short walk to metro and there are always taxis just outside the door. Breakfast was acceptable –but nothing special. Good value for Rome. Be careful with getting taxi from the train station – we had a poor experience – taxi meter was indicated an inappropriate fare. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel , great position , the perfect honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: angel9380
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this wonderful hotel for 4 nights this May and can say that it was an amazing experience . The hotel is in a perfect location right in the heart of Rome very close to many tourist attractions. We arrived in Rome by plane and the hotel provided for us a limo service from the airport, they took care of every details, and gave us a room with the view of all ancient Rome. by the way, the whole hotel was recently redecorated and everything seemed new. They did a very nice job, great rooms! Also the staff of the hotel very professional with kind and gentle receptionists that gave us directions and recommended great restaurants. Breakfast served on the roof garden with a beautiful view of the city ; also very rich breakfast with fresh local pastry which are to die for. Our honeymoon was perfect , thanks for everything guys. Hats off for a job well done.

Reviews.Title: “Scalinata was it's usual fine and funky self.”
Reviews.Author: VicinBellevue
Reviews.Content: Splendid location, charming (don't expect the Hassler) rooms, some with wonderful rooftop decks. Very nice breakfast in the breakfast room included. In-room safes, everything you need but washcloths in the bathroom. Warm and helpful staff, great restaurants nearby, and a cafe/bar right next door for tea, lunch or an after-dinner grappa. We had a volcano delay and were welcomed back to our same room after a two-week cruise hiatus. We were here for the first time six years ago, and it's as good as ever.

Reviews.Title: “Best Wedding anniversary! Yet... :)”
Reviews.Author: bellimario
Reviews.Content: My wife organized a very big surprise for my wedding anniversary: a trip to Rome. Never mind me that bought her only an Ipod and flowers! ;) So she organizes in secret an entire vacation, calling the hotel, organizing with the hotel the limo, museum guides, Vatican guides and the hotel, after she spoke with the manager, helped organizing even a private visit with the Pope! (How did she do that? They call the visit private but there were other 20 people with us, but hey....it was the Pope!). The hotel was perfect. New rooms, the manager said that they finished our room 2 days before we got there; and it was true, everything smelled new! New furniture and everything else seemed new. The breakfast was rich with everything to eat. Fabio 1 and Fabio 2, the receptionists are very helpful and funny.... Fabio 1 tells everyone everything about his life.... if you need to know something you can ask me! I m kidding. :) We found a bottle of champagne and flowers offered by the hotel, at our arrival. That was nice, also. What to say? Everything was great. The location is perfect! You can walk everywhere... the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain etc...the subway stops near the hotel. I forgot..... after the Ipod I made it up to my wife buying her jewelry from Bulgari near Piaza di Spagna. I recommend the hotel to everyone, it it warm, and they make feel like staying with friends. Bye

Reviews.Title: “This quaint hotel was extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: shepardspi
Reviews.Content: Out stay was wonderful. The rooms, although small, were well appointed and extremely comfortable. The employees went out of their way to accomodate our requests and show us their city. Fabio was exceptional he treated us like family. It was a magical vacation. Their complimentary breakfast buffet was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “A great space in perfect location--one of our favorites!”
Reviews.Author: dannyboy2_10
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely junior suite, newly refurbished with drapes and wall coverings, perfect air conditioning, double-glazed soundproof windows. Bathroom was clean, good hot water, etc. Whoever has been dissing this hotel recently is off the mark! We stayed here 10 years ago, loved it then, and were more impressed this time. Good buffet breakfasts are included on a lovely balcony looking out over the city. We saw absolutely no sign of lack of cleanliness. A great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: RemyI
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Scalinata Di Spagna for three nights and had an amazing time. For our first trip to Rome the location could not have been better, the wonderful roof deck was a perfect place to relax after a long day exploring Rome. The hotel staff was wonderful they anticipated our needs and made sure all of our expectations were met and exceeded. I would definately recommend this hotel. Perfect and romantic bed and breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Concierge staff very helpful, adjoining restaurant good.”
Reviews.Author: ZipTripCanada
Reviews.Content: We only stopped at this hotel for a light lunch on a quiet Sunday afternoon. Was afraid of hidden costs because they brought "extras" but it was all included, light lunch for two 23 Euros, food nice. Staff were good, and they sent us to the concierge desk when we were lost, where they were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly, Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MariannenJim
Reviews.Content: I am so sorry to report that my fellow Trip Advisor members' reports are largely accurate. I had booked a deluxe room with view, based on the wildly positive reviews in about 5 travel books. It was listed as a special choice in Fodors and Frommers. Only after I'd made the reservation did I see the reviews on Tripadvisor. I'll never make that mistake again. We weren't miserable, and it's true, the location is fantastic. But the so-called view was of about 5 of the Spanish steps and mostly buildings blocking the view. And it's true, light bulbs were missing, and the place has a certain seediness. The mattresses could use replacing. Still, the help was very nice about reservations and advice. We'd stay in the same neighborhood again but not the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location is not important when the hotel is undesirable”
Reviews.Author: pilady430
Reviews.Content: Although the location of this hotel is great, the hotel itself was a huge disappointment. The rooms were not clean with inches of accumulating dust along the floor edges and moldy, stained bathrooms. For what they charge, you would think they would invest money in renovations. Oh, and skip the breakfast...find a nice pasticceria for fresh rolls and pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Nonconformist
Reviews.Content: If your criteria for selecting a hotel is location, then look no further. I had researched the hotel online and through travel guide publications, which described this as "Rome's most famous little boutique hotel" and gave it a three star rating. I will concede and give it one star for its location. The hotel was run down. Cleanliness was not a top priority. There was mildew in the shower walls, around the shower hardware, the walls in the back of the toilet and the bidet. The bathing soap was so small they could fit into the palms of a two year old, try bathing with that!. The towels barely dried a recently bathed person. The dust on the chaise lounge had permanently changed the color of the fabric, a corner of the lounge was ripped. The curtains were cover with dust, one wonders if they were ever cleaned. The bed linen was akin to sandpaper. I believe the bed linens and towel were cleaned because it appear they sent them out for cleaning. The bed skirt was ripped torn and worn. Turn down service? Not in this hotel. You were luck they went in once a day to make the bed and leave fresh towels. If you are thinking personal service for breakfast, forget it. The eggs were laid out since 7:30 am, I think because that was the time the placed opened for breakfast. Coffee and juice were from a machine. Assorted pastry were laid out. Try to get information about tickets to tourist attractions and taxis felt like we were seeking undercover information. I found out that we could arrange them by ourselves for 1/3 of the actual cost. for the tourist attactions. You got free internet service, but funny how if you sought out to purchase online for tickets or to find out rates on other hotel these were blocked. We felt manipulated, treated like idiots and absolutely ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Purple11
Reviews.Content: Friends who had stayed here several years ago recommended it, so we were expecting a very different experience. The hotel is quite run-down. Several of the light fixtures in the room were broken (I had no working light by my bed) and when we told the front desk, they said they would attend to it but never did. The shower also did not work properly. Also, while we asked for dinner recommendations, the staff had no suggestions. There is no elevator, and no one offered to help us bring our luggage downstairs. The balcony view was of the facing of another building. Other than location, this hotel did not have much to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Ray23
Reviews.Content: Located on the top of the Spanish steps. Beautiful view from the rooftop garden.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service -When I left passports at the HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: HarperMaryland
Reviews.Content: My husband & I and friends stayed at Hotel Scalinata Di Spagna in July. It was the first stop on our Italy trip. We loved the location and hospitality from the minute we arrived at the hotel. We stayed 4 days , enjoying the delicious breakfasts and roof top location. We left the hotel to pick up our rental car at the airport and we were asked to show our passports. That's when I realized I left both passports in the safe at the hotel. I immediately contacted Fabio who reassured me that he could send them to our next hotel on the Amalfi Coast. The passports arrived 2 days later. What could have been a real disaster ( lost passports) was a minor inconvenience. Fabio was gracious,reassuring and just wonderful! The hotel and staff was a fabulous opener to an incredible Italian holiday. HarperMaryland

Reviews.Title: “delightful, charming and stylish”
Reviews.Author: riretteLondon
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to write this review for some time. I've stayed in a few nice hotels in this area but this place is a real gem. It is the very opposite of a soulless chain hotel. It's extremely chic, tastefully decorated with just the right touch of glamour and style. My room was very clean (which is a basic requirement and expected) and stylish. Lovely fabrics and polished surfaces. I would be very surprised if my room was an exception as the hotel was almost full. The breakfast room was very pretty and relaxing and there was no problem with delays. I would be very suspicious of any reviews that say this place was dirty, worn or dingy. A great place for those are appreciate an exquisite boutique feel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: anchise
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Nice and helpfull staff. The room was quite big with a nice view on Piazza TRinità dei Monti. The room was quiet and very clean. I recommend it to everyone. P.S: they also have a wireless network, very fast and FREE.

Reviews.Title: “Family-owned warmth in a can't-be-beat location”
Reviews.Author: Mandy_Beth
Reviews.Content: In months on the road, a long weekend in Rome was the only real downtime my husband and I were going to have. I found this hotel on another travel site and contacted them directly to ask questions. The owner -- Fabio -- answered every one of my questions and even upgraded us to a balcony when we got there. The breakfast is lovely, and you can't beat the view from the terrace. Plus, unlike other friends who had to walk long ways to play tourist, we were in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel at top of Spanish Steps.”
Reviews.Author: deetour26
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Umbria and spent 3 days in Rome staying at the Hotel Scalinata de Spagna. It is located at the top of the Spanish Steps across the street from the upscale hotel Hassler (which has a wonderful view from its rooftop restaurant and bar). Although the Scalinatta is small its rooms are well decorated and the service is good. Charming Fabio at the front desk was very helpful with a car rental and restaurant suggestions. Breakfast was good enough and the rooftop room with adjoining terrace was delightful even though the view was limited. My only suggestion would be to replace the worn out carpet on the stairs. The location at the top of the Steps is wonderful and it is a short walking distance to Via Condotti and many wonderful sights, restaurants and shops. For location and nice rooms, I would definitely recommend this for a stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location. Friendly staff. Small Room. Large Bill.”
Reviews.Author: CJA23
Reviews.Content: Its true about the location. Very Nice area and easy to get to. We took the train from the airport and the metro here. There is an ELEVATOR that takes you up to the top of the Spanish steps from the metro so dont worry about carrying your luggage up. The staff is very friendly. The hotel is tiny! and very simple...but not bad.Great WiFi connection!!Dont expect anything too luxiruious but its defintely very clean(except for the rugs on the stairway) The rooms are very small but they tell me this is normal in Rome??. Breakfast is simple but nice. The only thing that bother me was the bill, especially since the rates vary significantly from day to day if you look at the website. I book at 190/night, then when I got here, the rate was 150/night on the website for the same room period and same room. (40 Euros is a lot!). There are no views from the rooms and there is construction going on so you cant eally fully open the windows. The view from the top where you have breakfast is not high enough to see Rome but is a cute place to have coffee. Air conditioning is excellent and the bathrooms are spotless and modern. Overall, I think this is a nice little hotel but somewhat overprice. I would surely stay here again but only if I get a better rate (less than E150/off season). 190 is too much in the off season.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Jub06
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on the top of the Spanish Steps. Charming decoration. Clean. Very friendly and helpful manager that helped us find a last minute tour to Vatican Museum. The outdoor breakfast was simple and nice. We got the room at the last minute for EUR 120 for a two-person room with double bed and EUR 140 for a 3-person bedroom. (Booked at 8 am and check in at 11 am on the same day). For people that can't walk up and down the stairs often, this hotel might not be suitable because everything is at the bottom of the Spanish Steps (restaurants, shops, metro). I loved getting up early and be the only person on the Spanish Steps :)

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: INL
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Scalinata after a bad experience in a small hotel in Florence. We were apprehensive about what we might find. We were really happy with the choice. The location was great, the rooms were small but clean. The staff friendly and helpful. The roof top was a nice place to have breakfast although breakfast was no so great - actually skip it and grab a cappacino somewhere else We were a group of six. We all agreed that we would definitely book this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “A piece of heaven”
Reviews.Author: georgepaul
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel after we had seen all the good reviews people all over the world had written about Scalinata di Spagna and decided to see for ourselves. We are a family of three with a small child and asked for an extra bed for the baby and there was no problem in getting it. As we entered the hotel we could see that we had made the right decision on staying there because everything was so shiny and clean from the first step to the last. The receptionist was also very kind and nice to us the entire time of our stay there. We got a room on the first floor with a lovely view of Piazza di Spagna and all its surroundings. In the room there was a big tv with cable , telephone and a big bathroom with shower and tub. For directions and places to visit in Rome we asked the receptionists and got a lot of helpful answers so they were very kind also. The position of the hotel is perfect right in the heart of Rome , next to Piazza di Spagna and Fontana di Trevi ; two of Rome's best places to visit so I can say Scalinata Hotel is a piece of heaven on earth.We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “So peaceful there”
Reviews.Author: a_george47
Reviews.Content: We stayed there only for one night but decided that if ever in Rome again that is the perfect place to stay. The price for the room was not very expensive with breakfast and all taxes included. Everyone from the hotel was very kind especially the receptionist who also had a great sense of humor. The room we got was on the first floor , a very nice and quiet room which was just what we needed because we were pretty tired that night. The next day we got up at 11 and asked if we could still serve breakfast and they were king enough to say yes although breakfast is served until 10 o'clock. For our departure they arranged for a car to take us to the airport. Thank you and see you all next time.

Reviews.Title: “I would nt mind living in that Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Penguin888
Reviews.Content: I am surprised about the very diferent critics about this same place. How come, one calls the hotel rooms fithy but a next one states spotless rooms - staying the same month and the same type of room ? How come one calles the breakfeast poor and no attention at all, while a next one states great breakfeast and very sweet girls, very atentive up to preparing individual types of omeletes at wish.. Have been people staying on diferent paralell planets ? I myself know the area and had a friend make the reservation personaly at the hotel, because of its situation. A perfect joice: . My room was quite small, (actualy most hotel rooms in Rome are small) with a big enough balcony and a great view, especialy at night. I found the rooms - I have visited several - well cept and clean. And all the stuff very atentive and friendly. Breakfeast was great. The one girl L..... very busy but very friendly. The most important for me was the situation of the hotel. Hardly possible to find a better match for somebody to explore Rome on your own feet.. I would recomend it to anybody, except to people who dont like chating and lively Italians. But why should such person choose to visit Rome in first place ?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sebastianalan
Reviews.Content: Hotel Scalinata is the perfect hotel to stay in if you go to Rome. Situated very close to Piazza di Spagna the hotel is always full with guests because of the many tourist attractions around it so book yous stay there in time. Just 5 minutes by foot is the famous Fontana di Trevi and the center of the city is nearby. The hotel is very nice and clean and the staff very helpful.The rooms very spacious with a large bed and sparkly bathroom. Breakfast is served in a buffe style in the hotels' dinning room upstairs with a great view of the city. Travelling from the hotel is easy , the metro station is 2 minutes away and the bus station not far. It was a great experience being at Scalinata.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice hotel, terrific staff!”
Reviews.Author: IslandGirl123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from seven nights in Rome at stayed at the Scalinata. We had a great experience! Okay, the rooms are small and Frommer did exaggerate a bit. But the pluses are many! Great location...you can walk all over Rome from this hotel. The views right outside the door are incredible. Yes, you do have to walk up and down the Spanish steps but it is fun and there is always something happening at any hour of the day or night! Every night you can watch the sun set over the Vatican. There are lots of great restaurants just a short stroll away. The staff is very helpful. Cannot do enough to make sure that you have a comfortable visit. There is help with your bags and anything else that you need. They are always available to help with questions and provide maps and directions. Breakfast is certainly adequate and you will not go away hungry. We would definitely stay here again. And recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: Quahog17
Reviews.Content: I booked a reservation 6 monthes ago.I contacted the hotel directly by phone, booked 3 deluxe rooms, gave them a credit card and received a confirmation. 3 days a go they left me a message that they needed to speak to me. I called back immediatly. The hotel wanted to know if I still planned on staying there as the reservation was made "so long ago" and the person who had made the reservation no longer worked there(?). I assurred them that I still planned on staying at the hotel along with 4 other people. I was told that there was no problem. Yesterday I got an e-mail from them telling me that the problem with my reservation could not be fixed. I stayed there 10 years ago and they neglected to tell me that there was major construction going on in the hotel (next to my suite at 7:00am). The second time I arrived at the hotel they didn't have my reservation but could still accomodate me. I thought it was a fluke. It wasn't. Read the other reviews and stay away!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: valarieh
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay here. We booked after the high recommendations from Frommers, but we should have listened to the negative reviews of previous guests! On top of the Spanish Steps, with views of these steps from rooms 10 or 12??? NO WAY!!! How could this possibly be considered the moderately priced alternative to staying at the Hasstler? NO WAY!!! We stayed in room #12, the coveted room which the "expert" reviewers rave about because of the view. The view??? Oh, if you get out on your terrace, which is the size of a doormat, and look directly right, you have a SLIVER of a view of the top of the Spanish Steps. The view is really of the dirty, ugly backside of the other buildings. Speaking of dirty, this hotel was DIRTY! My husband got terribly ill after staying here, resulting in a trip to the Emergency Room, and he swears it was because of this hotel. We stayed here during our honeymoon, after great research, and we regret this more than words could say. The carpeting felt nasty dirty. The comforter/blanket on the bed probably was never cleaned, let alone between guests. The bathroom was fairly cleaned. The check-in was mediocre. The breakfast was not good, and no one was around to assist. The roof top terrace was nice, and probably the only good thing about the hotel, but not worth staying here. Being on top of the Steps only meant that you had to climb up and down and up and down the Steps everytime you wanted to go anywhere. It was totally OVERPRICED and dirty and not good. We cancelled our reservation to stay here again once returning from the Amalfi Coast, and instead stayed at the Capo d' Africa...which was AWESOME. The Scalinata Di Spagna was our first experience of Italy, and it really turned us off to Rome, unfortunately. Stay away from this hotel. Stay at the Capo d' Africa instead.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the concierge !”
Reviews.Author: pierreb66
Reviews.Content: First of all, I just want to say that I work in a hotel, so I am very good in recognizing all the "tricks" the hotel's may play on a customer. I can't think of a good comment for the concierge at Hotel Scalinata di Spagna.... They are all very unprofessional! The welcome at the hotel is enough to give you the worst impressions: there is no porter! We had to carry our own lugagge as the concierge, a man called Lorenzzo, was to busy talking on his cell phone. The room he gave us was small, but clean and bright. We unpacked our things and after 10-15 minutes the concierge knocked at our door saying that he may have another bigger room at the same price (Why didn't he show the big rooms in the beginning?! Maybe it's just a scam to fish for tips?!). We checked out the room and we decided to move to the new one. As we we walking towards the new room (Lorenzzo this time helped with the lugagge), I apologized for making a little chaos in our first little room and gave Lorenzzo 5 euros to give the girls that cleans the room. He said it wasn't necessary (but he had already put the money in his pocket) as he personally would have cleaned the room. We arrived at our room, the concierge placed the lugagge on the bed and than he started talking about these wonderful city guides he knows, that he can organize; he had the best restaurants already booked for us etc. DO NOT follow anyone of his advices! Although i have a lot of experience in the field I fell for his "kind advices". He kept talking and talking and wouldn't leave our room.... insisting that he gave us a better room, a superior and he saved us 90 euros etc. We had to give him 20 euros to make him leave the room. The guide he recommended practically knew less stuff on the Sistine Chapel than myself and charged us 180 euros! The restaurant he recommended "robbed" us for 290 euros for a bottle of wine, coke, pasta and meat. Please, do not use their offers! Find you own guide (the next day we took the Green Line buses...it was cheap and perfect), go to the known restaurants from Frommers guide book or other, use a taxi instead of the limo service (it's a lie ...there is no limo it's just a 4 year old Mercedes). Tha taxi has a fixed price of 40 euros from the airport to the centre of Rome, use the taxi..you save almost 50%. After 3o min in our second bigger room, on our way out of the hotel, we saw a young woman was cleaning our old small room, not Lorenzzo as he said when he took the 5 euro bill. The next day we asked the maid if Lorenzzo gave her something from us and she confirmed my suspicions: he didn't give her our tip and he didn't even clean the room as he promised. The other concierge are pretty much the same: there is one that talks 24/7 and smokes like a chuchu train... , the night shift concierge is a young guy with no tie and a very wrinkled shirt . Breakfast is quite nice maybe a little poor, the view from the terrace is great and the girls who serve it are quite lovely. The same girls clean the rooms also. If you want to tip someone, tip directly that person...there is no guarantee that the concierge will give the person you wanted your gift. We left a detailed letter for the owner (unfortunately we left it to Lorenzzo ) describing all our problems, wrote all our numbers and emails, but no one wrote back! Probably Lorenzzo never passed the letter to the administrator. For the rest: the hotel positions is great, it's located in the heart of Rome, clean rooms, has free wireless Internet service in the rooms. We recommend the hotel, but stay alert to the fake help the concierge provide.

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: Lisa202
Reviews.Content: All in all our stay here was good. The rooms were clean, albiet a bit small. Good location at the top of the Spanish Steps walkable to all major sites of the city. Beware of the concierge's reccommendations for dinner if you are looking for something authentic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LynnMonmoujthshireUK
Reviews.Content: Good welcome, excellent location at the top of the Spanish Steps and easy to walk to so many places. The hotel has the real Italian atmosphere - don't go there if you want a 5 star International hotel. The bed was large and comfy and the room and bathroom spotless. Staff very helpful. Perhaps the only minus that we thought was the breakfast - could have been better - for Italy I thought coffee would be flavoursome but perhaps they are catering for the milder taste that generally Americans prefer! All in all though we really enjoyed the hotel and the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: toddj
Reviews.Content: I was in 7 hotels that month throughout Europe and this was the WORST! The room was very small, dark, and dingy, with dated linens. The only thing decent about the hotel was the location, if you don't mind walking up 300 steps every time you return to your hotel. The worst part was the fact that the place overcharged me for an online reservation I made for the wrong date. My mistake okay, but the concierge didn't catch it and it cost me 500 Euros for a date I wasn't even in Rome. The manager was rude and completely unwilling to take any responsibility. Save yourself a huge problem and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest vacation”
Reviews.Author: Miaonuki
Reviews.Content: Hello What to say about Hotel Scalinata... Best position in the world: just above the Spanish Steps. Great view from the rooms and the roof garden where they also serve breakfast. A small hotel, very quiet, very friendly staff and very helpful also. Renato, the owner, is just delicious. He helped my two sons with their laptops to get connected to the internet (the hotel offers a free broadband wireless connection in all the rooms and public areas). He also booked us the best restaurants and arranged for private guides to the Vatican museums and the Colosseo(it's advisable to get a private guide as the make you skip the queues- to get to the Cappella Sistina you can wait even for 3 hours without a guide...there are private guides even at the entrace of the museum). The rooms are very quiet, medium size and bright. Fabio, one of the other concierge gives good advice on restaurants and convenient shops. The girl that serves breakfast, Mirella is very sweet and gentle. She prepares the best scrambled eggs! She even makes figures with the napkins... Nerti (i hope i wrote the name properly), the young guy that does the night shift helped us book train tickets to Naples over the internet and Adriano resolved some computer issues for my sons. The rooms were very nicely cleaned by Luisa. She brought fresh fruit in the rooms every day and the hotel didn't charge for that. The hotel and the gotel staff made our vacation perfect! We enjoyed ourselves very much and we recommend it to all the people that look for a quiet vacation without any problem. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Babi14
Reviews.Content: I wanted to write a review because I've stayed in this hotel for a week end with my boyfriend and another couple of friends last February and we found it very charming, while I read very different opinions. First of all, the plus is the location... Trinità dei Monti means the heart of Rome, and it means that you can go around on foot. Something rare in Rome. So the price does not seem too expensive to me, considering this fact. Secondly, I read very different opinions....but I think that the fascinating aspect of this place is that this is not a common or standard hotel: it's like being in a private house a few steps from Piazza di Spagna. You won't find big spaces, or spa, or swimming pools, etc... just nice bedrooms, clean bathrooms, a small terrace where you can have your breakfast looking at the Rome's roofs. All of this tasting the flavour of the genuine Roman hospitality (sometimes...no, often they can be very disappointing, trust me): the concierge has always been very friendly with us, giving advice on the best places near the hotel where we could have a perfect Roma's dinner, but also taking care of our car (he called a parking near the hotel and they came to pick up the car without any problem). Chattering is another roman way to be kind. Oh, yes, I think that breakfast is only until 10 o'clock, so at 10 you will not find anyone serving you: you just have to take what you need by yourself. Definitely, it's going to be my favourite address in Rome, since I live at 200 km from there, but sometimes I have to go on business trips. In this way, I'll feel like home!

Reviews.Title: “Zero service!”
Reviews.Author: Kosta65
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you about our experience at the Hotel Scalinata di Spagna in Rome. We booked directly with the hotel website (some friends of ours had already been there). When we arrived there we were given a nice room. The price was fair (we checked other hotels after the check-in). Everything seemed to proceed well in the beginning: the staff was helpful, but not professional (the guy at the reception never stops talking about his life (who cares?!)), the lobby is small, but very chic, they had free WIFI in the lobby and room(that's cool), breakfast was rich and the girls who served it were very helpful and friendly. The last days we had some ugly surprises: we went on the terrace garden to have our usual quiet breakfast and found all tha tables full of plates and nobody was there to clean them. This happened around 10 am. We waited for 15 minutes and nobody showed up, except other hotel guests. We went to the concierge to refer to him the problem and after 5 minutes a young man (the waitress had probably the day off) showed up and said that he would come on the terrace right away. After other 5 minutes he came up and cleared 1 table. We wanted to eat our usual eggs, cappuccino and croissants...but surprise: the eggs were burned down, there was no bread, the cappuccino was brought to us after 12 minutes(other guests kept coming for breakfast on the small terrace (only 4 tables) and they formed a big queue in the hall and the breakfast room). There were no more croissants, either. There was only some fruit and cereal to eat. We got back to the concierge explained to him that this treatment is unacceptable, waiting all this time for breakfast compromised our tour at the Vatican and told him that we wanted to leave earlier to go to another hotel. At this time another surprise: the concierge (the guy that talks a lot about himself) threatened to charge us for the remaining period. We left right away! I do not know yet if they charged my card, but i will definetely fight this. Other things: the hotel is clean, has the best position, but the staff has zero hotel skills.(not all of them: the concierge in the evening is very polite, helpful and funny, the waitress and the cleaning girl are too) ... One more thing: there is no porter...so you have to carry your own luggage. You decide if you want to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: boy579
Reviews.Content: Good location , helpful staff but dowdy , scruffy central communal areas. Breakfasts very poor and disorganised.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: psix12
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms at the Hotel Scalinata di Spagna for 3 nights in middle August 2006. Hotel rooms were excellent, services were prompt, rooms had old charm. Our plane out of Detroit was cancelled (normal NWA) after the technician could not fix the problem and we did not get in until the next day. We had a private tour scheduled of Ancient Rome for the morning. My son & wife went on the tour and the Hotel Concierge monitored their progress so that when we finally arrived he sent us in a taxi to join the tour. The Hotel is very well located for all activities in Rome. We stongly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Hotel Scalinata Di Spagna”
Reviews.Author: NETraveler64
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Scalinata Di Spagna for a few nights in July 2006 and enjoyed our stay: Pros: Fantastic location at the top of the Spanish Steps; extremely friendly and helpful staff; clean rooms; great air conditioning in the room (which was welcome during a very hot few days in Rome); nice breakfast in rooftop garden. Cons: Our room was tiny; not very user friendly lobby; expensive, but it is Rome, and location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Hotel Scalinata”
Reviews.Author: JulieGeorgia
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is excellent, they went out of their way to make our trip special. We felt the value was very good and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: MasterGee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Scalinata Di Spagna for 6 nights over the course two separate 3 night stays in late January 2006. I actually moved from the Albergo del Sole Al Pantheon to this hotel after one sleepless night and was ecstatic with my decision. The Hotel Scalinata di Spagna is very clean & comfortable, the staff goes out of their way to accommodate any special requests, and the location is amazing. Also, I found the wireless internet to be a plus. Like others have noted, the concierge is able to point you to great restaurants that are filled with locals (not only tourists). True, there is no restaurant or grand lobby, but who needs that when fine shops and restaurants are only a staircase away? I will definitely stay at this hotel again largely due to its charm, location, and service, and will freely recommend it to friends. Here's a little hint: room #11 has the best view of the Spanish Steps (from a small private balcony!)

Reviews.Title: “Charming and warm with great service”
Reviews.Author: Carol23Maryland
Reviews.Content: Two couples just returned from a 2 week vacation in Italy. We spent 5 delightful nights at this small gem of a hotel. Quaint, clean room with a more than adequate bathroom especially in contrast to other bathrooms in Italy; great location at the top of the Spanish Steps and close to incredible shopping- forced us to climb the steps everyday which was great exercise! The concierge was so helpful and recommended some terrific non-touristy restaurants.... we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend this hotel and... another plus- free Internet!! A real find.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Place”
Reviews.Author: enabz
Reviews.Content: Quaint little pensione in Rome at the top of the Spanish steps. Great location. Service was excellent. Rooftop garden serving breakfast daily (included). Rooms were small but clean. Very helpful in providing any assistance with tours or reservations. Highly recommend. Enjoyed our stay immensely. Would return if in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Romantico”
Reviews.Author: maldonadomanuel60
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife spent 3 enchanting days at this romantic hotel at the top of the Spanish Steps. The room was not very large, but quiet and decorated in very nice classic style. The staff was very helpful and spoke English and some Spanish. When we told them that we were there for our 10th anniversary, they've put a bottle of champagne and flowers in our room. We travel a lot for work, but only in that hotel, we were able to use free Internet, not only on the guest computers in the lobby, but even with our laptop with the wireless connection in the room and on the terrace. Every morning we had breakfast on the hotel roof garden enjoying the view of the city roofs(the first day we woke up late, but the waitress was very helpful and served us anyway). We will recommend this place to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely one of the best places I have stayed”
Reviews.Author: netdogca
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best places I have ever stayed. Everything from the service, to the room to the location was absolutely 5 star. I had made an error on my reservation dates when booking but when I talked to the staff prior to arrival they graciously adjusted the booking and helped me get a room elsewhere for the one night I was to be without. Where else would you get that service? If going to Rome is ever on your list of things to do, add to that list a stay at this hotel. Make your reservations early. A lot of people are discovering this gem.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location-great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Naod21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely the place to stay when in Rome...Rooms are soo nice, and quaint..Excellent bathroom(TUB)...Roomy, clean, decor is so pretty...the front desk very helpful and pleasant. Offers free internet service.. The location is at the top of the spanish steps....Amazing view.. I can't say enough about this hotel. I would definitely stay here again! Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have read the reviews on this Tripadvisor before reserving a room at the Scalinata di Spagna Hotel. I 've seen the beautiful pictures of the hotel and of the view on the site and, although I was a little concern because of the 2 negative messages, I booked a double room for me and my wife. The hotel arranged a car to pick us up at the airport and when we arrived (we had arrived very early ) they offered us breakfast on a wonderful terrace (Saint Peter's church can be seen from the terrace) and and took care of the luggage while we began our sightseeing tour. The rooms are decorated in a classic style, the whole hotel has an interesting classic tone. The persons that work there are very kind and helpful. They gave us precious advice on the restaurants and museums. At the end of our journey we were very satisfied by the friendly atmosphere of this hotel. We suggested this hotel at other friends and they too were much pleased of this 'home in rome' how they like to call it. Hope this helps other people with their decision.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my 3 other family members stayed at the Scalinata di Spagna Hotel in Rome. Everything was ok: good service, nice quiet rooms (very quiet rooms considering the positions, a little small, but checked 2 other hotels during the stay and found out that all the rooms are small in the centre of Rome), great view from the terrace and from the rooms on the first floor(at least ours was delightful). The receptionist gave us useful directions for the restaurants and arranged pick up from the airport with a limo(costs a lttle bit more than a taxi, but it's more comfortable). The position is strategic: on top of the Spanish Steps right in front of the Hassler(visited it - splendid hotel, but the most expensive). All of us were pleased of our stay at this hotel in Rome Hope this will be of some help.

Reviews.Title: “no room at the inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stay away!!! We had confirmed reservations for our last night in Italy and our anniversary at this hotel. Upon arrival we were informed that they had overbooked and they had no room for us. I had reserved this room six weeks in advance. They did not have another hotel for us, it was late in the day and their recomendation was horrible!! Do not stay or attempt to stay at this hotel. If you reserve and don't show up they'll charge you but if you reserve and do show up- you'll get no room at the inn. This should be illegal.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel - this is a one star quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading numerous reviews on the internet and on frommers we thought we would try this hotel. What an utter disapointment. It is no exaggeration to say that this is an overpriced and awful hotel. I had been liaising with the hotel for over two weeks by email and phone to make sure that we would get a good room. Upon arriving at the small and dark hotel, located next to a hot dog stand at the top of the Spanish steps!, we were shown into our room on the ground floor(not what i had requested!). It is more of a youth hostel type of one star room. It was extremely small, the bathroom had not been properply cleaned, the bedding was stained, the carpet filthy - absolutely shocking. We walked out and pointed out the problem to man at the desk, who didn't care. This is absolutely not a four star hotel and i am so surprised that is it recommened in guide books. If you are looking for small, dark, old fashioned, tired and a really depressing hotel, then this is for you. I would also not recommend staying at the top of the Spanish steps, it is slightly grubby. I would recommend the hotels at the bottom such as the HOtel D'inglitherra or the Russie.

Reviews.Title: “A dlightful very small hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The position is superb and despite the large number of noisy but friendly people on the Spanish Steps each evening, our room was very quiet. Our room was not large but adequate and perfectly clean with a bowl of fresh fruit on arrival. The staff were very helpful whenever we asked for advice on how to get there by public transport. Despite a previous comment fresh squeezed orange juice is there for the asking

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at the Scalinata di Spagna for 2 nights and really enjoyed it. It is hard to explain--it's a little quirky and not cheap but it was cozy and charming. Renaldo was terrific and helped us with reservations etc. We were a little worried about noise from the Steps but heard very little--we slept with the windows open. The terrace and breakfast were fine-don't expect a panoramic view of the city. The location is the best, we walked everywhere and still made it up the steps with no problem. It might not be for everyone--but it made our visit to Rome perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: 2travelrs
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay tremendously. The room (#6)was quite large for European standards and the bed very comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful in every matter. We would have preferred fresh fruit instead of canned at breakfast but otherwise good. Excellent quiet location at the hub of everything. Terrace very relaxing and sunny. Front desk got us into the Vatican Museo at a moments notice so we did not have to stand in the line that was 3 football fields long! Would stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Scalinata Di Spagna
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza Trinita dei Monti 17, 00187 Rome, Italy
